name: Traditional Scythian-Occupied Region East of Ukraine
description: A map of the traditional areas inhabited by the Scythians, stretching east from the Ukraine.

name: Kievan Rus
description: Kievan Rus (862-1242) was a medieval political federation located in modern-day Belarus, Ukraine, and part of Russia (the latter named for the Rus, a Scandinavian people). The name Kievan Rus is a modern-day (19th century) designation but...

name: Saint Sophia Cathedral, Kyiv
description: Saint Sophia Cathedral in Kyiv, Ukraine is a monument of 11th-century architecture, painting, and mosaic work. The cathedral was named after Hagia Sophia and, as the main temple of the state, played the role of its spiritual, political and...

name: Khotyn Fortress
description: Khotyn fortress is a complex of fortifications situated on the hilly right bank of the Dniester in Khotyn, Ukraine. It consists of a 13th-century stronghold and an 18th-century bastion surrounding it. It is one of the oldest preserved fortifications...

name: The History of the Ukrainian Region
description: The area of eastern Europe which is today Ukraine, particularly the northern shore of the Black Sea, has attracted many cultures and empires over the centuries. In this collection, we examine the history of that region and look at the Scythians...

name: Khotyn Fortress
description: Khotyn Fortress is a 13th-century fortification in Khotyn, Ukraine. It is located on the right bank of Dniester and was an important defence and trade point.

name: Holy Cross Cathedral, Uzhhorod
description: The Holy Cross Cathedral is the main Greek Catholic church of Uzhhorod, Ukraine and is the residence of the Mukachevo bishops. The cathedral was founded in 1640. The exterior of the cathedral is done in the neoclassical style.

name: Peasant family by Taras Shevchenko
description: A painting by Taras Shevchenko. The artist created this work during his first trip to Ukraine. In this painting he portrayed a family scene near the house: a young couple is happy observing the first steps of their child. Oil on canvas...

name: Potocki Mausoleum Chapel in Pechera
description: The Mausoleum Chapel of Potocki Family in Pechera, Vinnytsia Oblast, Ukraine. Built in 1904 according to the project of Władysław Horodecki, the decorations were made by Emilio Sala. The chapel was designed on the form of a Latin cross...

name: Khotyn Stronghold from the North
description:
North Tower and Commandant's Tower of Khotyn Stronghold.
Khotyn fortress, Ukraine.

name: Ruins of the Bastion of the Khotyn Fortress
description: Ruins of the 18th-century bastion wall, which surrounds the Khotyn Fortress, Ukraine.

name: Courtyard of the Khotyn Stronghold
description:
The southern part of the courtyard of the Khotyn Stronghold, known as "The yard of warriors".
Khotyn fortress, Ukraine.

name: Mauritius Square
description: Ancient astronomical observatory near Mezhyrich Village, Pavlogradsky District, Dniprovsky Region, Ukraine. Built in the II millennium BCE by Indo-European tribes. It takes the form of a crab.

name: Saint Sophia Cathedral, Kyiv
description: Cathedral of St. Sophia, Kyiv, founded in 1011 by the Great Duke of Kyiv Vladimir the Great (958 - c. 1015). It is the most ancient and fully preserved church of Eastern Europe. Inside the cathedral, there are plenty of well-preserved...

name: Interior of Saint Sophia Cathedral, Kyiv
description: The interior and altar of Saint Sophia Cathedral of Kyiv.

name: Bell Tower of Saint Sophia Cathedral, Kyiv
description: Bell tower of Saint Sophia Cathedral, Kyiv, built in the Cossack Baroque style between 1699-1706, funded by Hetman Ivan Mazepa. The height of the bell tower is 76 metres.

name: Map of the Khotyn Fortress
description: Map of the Khotyn Fortress, published in The Atlas of the Fortresses of the Russian Empire, 1830s.

name: Fresco in the Saint Sophia Cathedral
description:
Well-preserved fresco of a saint, 11th century.
Saint Sophia Cathedral of Kyiv.

name: Battle of Khotyn (1621)
description:
The Battle of Khotyn (1621), oil on canvas painting by Józef Brandt, depicting Jan Karol Chodkiewicz (on the white horse), 1867.
National Museum, Warsaw.

name: Portrait of Ivan Mazepa
description:
Portrait of Cossack Hetman Ivan Mazepa in armour with St. Andrew's ribbon, oil on canvas painting, 18th century.
Art Museum, Dnipro.
